WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic:
To remember the reading ãŸ, we use the word "taco."
You're in the rice field... but when you lean down to examine the rice more closely, you see that it's not rice that's growing, it's a bunch of little tacos (ãŸ), blossoming out of the ground.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Smell the tacos. Touch the tacos. Taste the tacos. This is definitely a very strange rice field.

origin_of_ch_char_book: Ancient eastern people worshiped the earth. So, they tried to preserve the natural land rather than cultivate and develop it. They thought of the earth as their mother because all the creatures come from the earth. (é‡Œ, li, place, inside) The upper one (ç”°, tian=tâ€™ien, field) means field divided into four places, and lower one (åœŸ, tu, soil) means the earth on which some corps are rising, and it also means an altar people gathering. The whole character means the village where people gather in the field, performing rites. In the past, people considered that the earth of their hometown would protect them, and they worshiped the god of their own territory by building an altar. This god of hometown would judge the people of the village whether to go to Heaven or to go to hell. (ç†, li, manage, reason) The left side of the symbol (ç‰, yu=yÃ¼, jade) is a jade bead, and the right side is a village where people live together. The ancient people believed that the jade are so pure than any other existences of the earth, and they believed that the jade is a soul of the land which can defeat the evil spirits. Because jade (ç‰) can judge people of the village with the spirit of the earth (åœŸ), is used as a meaning of control, manage, reason etc.,(ç”°, tian=tâ€™ien, field) depicts farmland divided into four areas. In olden times, the fields were not clearly divided to separate farmlands and hunting fields. Farmland was an area where one could hunt as well as farm.,Stone tools in shape of shovels (Neolithic Age) The symbol for boundary is this: (ç•Œ, jie, boundary). The upper part of the symbol is a field (ç”°, tian=tâ€™ien, field) and the left shows a person (äºº, ren, human) between the two things (ä»‹, jie, be situated between). He is now deciding the exact borders of the fields.,(å–®,å•, dan, single) portrays a tool used for hunting In ancient times. There are two pebbles above , and underneath the pebbles there are lines in the shape of the letter V (). This is an ancient form of a stone slingshot for shooting a stone. The middle character (ç”°, tian=tâ€™ien, field) means â€œfieldâ€. So this character implies that one is hunting in the wide field with the slingshot. A slingshot can only shoot one stone at a time. Therefore, a long time later when the stone slingshot disappeared, this character was no longer used to mean a weapon, instead it came to mean â€œsingle.â€
humanum_full_description_en:
Jia Jinwen is like a field. The fields criss-crossed. The original meaning is the field. In ancient times, hunting was closely related to agriculture, and hunting made preparations for farming. The ancients used fire to drive away wild beasts and burned the wild land overgrown with weeds and weeds into open land, which would be cultivated by people. Field hunting also has the effect of eliminating beasts on farmland, "Book of Rites. "Yue Ling": "Drive beasts, do not harm the grain." So the " Tian " for plowing the field and the " Tian " for hunting are exactly the same character (Qiu Xigui).

The oracle bone inscriptions are used as the original meaning of farmland, and "Compilation": 28628 "Wang Qishengtian", which means that the king inspects farmland. It also means hunting and hunting in the field, which was later written as "ç•‹", "Compilation" 24496: "The king goes to the field", which means that the king goes to hunt the beasts. "Tunnan" 226: "Wang Qitian Beast, died (no) ğ¢¦” (disaster)." "Tian Beast" means "hunting", that is, hunting. It is also used as official name and noble name, which is the " dian " of later generations, "Collection" 36511: "Tada (dian)". " Tian " was originally an official sent to a certain place by the king of Shang to be responsible for agricultural reclamation, and later became a vassal (Qiu Xigui).

Bronze inscriptions are used as the original meaning of fields, and Wei Ding: "Yu She Nu (Ru) Tian Wu Tian ", and the word " Tian " at the end is used as a unit, meaning that I will give you five fields. "Farm tools" means farm tools, and Sanshi plate: "I have paid Sanshi field tools", which means that I have given Sanshi farm tools. It is also pronounced " Dian ", which means that the princes said, and let Fangyi: "Princes: Hou, Tian (dian), male". Da Yu Ding: "Yin Bian Hou, Tian (Dian) ğ©¹ (and) Yin Zheng, Bai Pi, were willing to drink alcohol." It means that Hou, Dian, and Bai officials around the Shang Dynasty indulged alcoholism.

In the Warring States Zhongshan Kingdom, the inscription " ğ¤— " from the side of the " dog " is the meaning symbol, which specifically means the " field " of hunting. Zhongshan Wang Yuanhu: "Mao (miao) search ğ¤— (ç”°)hunting". "Gu Liang Chuan. "The Four Years of Huan Gong": "Spring is called fields, summer is called seedlings, autumn is called search, and winter is called hunting." "Book. "Wu Yi": "Don't dare to play in Youtian." Kong Yingda Shu: "Tian is hunting." "Yi. "Heng": "Tian has no birds." Kong Yingdashu: "The field is hunting."

"Said Wen": "Tian, Chen Ye. Trees and valleys are called fields, like the four å›—ten, the rice paddies are also made. Every field belongs to the field." Duan Yucai's note: "One of the rice paddies is like a rice paddy. "
humanum_short_description_en: " Tian " in Jiajin inscription is like a field. The original meaning is farmland.

Jia Jinwen is like a field. The fields criss-crossed. The original meaning is the field. In ancient times, hunting was closely related to agriculture, and hunting made preparations for farming. The ancients used fire to drive away wild beasts and burned the wild land overgrown with weeds and weeds into open land, which would be cultivated by people. Field hunting also has the effect of eliminating beasts on farmland, "Book of Rites. "Yue Ling": "Drive beasts, do not harm the grain." So the " Tian" for plowing the field and the " Tian" for hunting are exactly the same character (Qiu Xigui). The oracle bone inscriptions are used as the original meaning of farmland, and "Compilation": 28628 "Wang Qishengtian", which means that the king inspects farmland. It also means hunting and hunting in the field, which was later written as " ç•‹", "Compilation" 24496: "The king goes to the field", which means that the king goes to hunt the beasts. "Tunnan" 226: "Wang Qitian Beast, died (no) ğ¢¦” (disaster)." "Tian Beast" means "hunting", that is, hunting. It is also used as official name and noble name, which is the " dian" of later generations, "Collection" 36511: "Tada (dian)". " Tian" was originally an official sent to a certain place by the king of Shang to be responsible for agricultural reclamation, and later became a vassal (Qiu Xigui). Bronze inscriptions are used as the original meaning of fields, and Wei Ding: "Yu She Nu (Ru) Tian Wu Tian", and the word " Tian" at the end is used as a unit, meaning that I will give you five fields. "Farm tools" means farm tools, and Sanshi plate: "I have paid Sanshi field tools", which means that I have given Sanshi farm tools. It is also pronounced " Dian", which means that the princes said, and let Fangyi: "Princes: Hou, Tian (dian), male". Da Yu Ding: "Yin Bian Hou, Tian (Dian) ğ©¹ (and) Yin Zheng, Bai Pi, were willing to drink alcohol." It means that Hou, Dian, and Bai officials around the Shang Dynasty indulged alcoholism. In the Warring States Zhongshan Kingdom, the inscription " ğ¤—" from the side of the " dog" is the meaning symbol, which specifically means the " field" of hunting. Chinese dictionary definition of words
[â‘ ]ï¼»tiÃ¡nï¼½
["Guangyun" cuts in the last few years, flat first, set. ]
(1) Land used for farming.
(2) Refers to the field.
(3) Some areas refer specifically to paddy fields.
(4) The territory granted to relatives and ministers by ancient rulers.
(5) Farming.
(6) Especially refers to the farming.
(7) Officials in charge of agricultural affairs in ancient times.
(8) The calculation unit of ancient cultivated land area.
(9) Hunting.
(10) Especially refers to the gift of hunting and training in spring.
(11) Bass drum. One talk, snare drum.
(12) Many, many. See "Tian Sheng".
(13) Buddhist language. Tian is the righteousness of growth, and all people or things who can cultivate the morality or good rewards of practitioners are all fields.
(14) Mind can produce seedlings of good and evil, also known as Tian.
(15) Taoism refers to the place where God resides in the human body.
(16) Refers to the pubic region, a part of the human body.
(17) A zone where resources can be exploited. Such as coal fields; salt fields.
(18) Last name.

Radicals: ç”°  (rice-paddy)
Meaning Mnemonic
The rice paddy radical and the rice paddy kanji are the same, making this one super easy to remember, at least meaning-wise.
Just know your radicals, and you will know your kanji as well.
Reading Mnemonic
To remember the reading ãŸ, we use the word "taco."
You're in the rice field... but when you lean down to examine the rice more closely, you see that it's not rice that's growing, it's a bunch of little tacos (ãŸ), blossoming out of the ground.
Smell the tacos. Touch the tacos. Taste the tacos. This is definitely a very strange rice field.
